column2: NSPounds, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was taking this medication for a bacterial skin infection. After about 10 days I noticed that the joints in my wrist were hurting. Didn't think much of it, then after a few more days, my hips, knees and ankles started aching terribly. I called my doctor and she said I was having an allergic reaction to it and to discontinue using it right away. I've been off it for a week now and am still struggling with joint pain. I also was extremely fatigued while taking it. I would not recommend this product.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Im using Doxycycline for facial acne and have found it to cause sever stomach pain in the hour after taking it. I have come close, but so far have not, thrown up. Taking a very large amount of water with the medication almost completely protects my body form this reaction. However taking so much water so quickly cases some discomfort as well. Although I am using topical gel Diffein (adapoline) in conjunction with Doxycyline to try to really defeat my acne. After a month on  Doxycyline and Differin their has been no effect on my acne.
